Deficiency Narrative: During a heightened monitoring visit, a staff member who transports children did not have a copy of their driver's license or driver's license check in their personnel file.
Correction Narrative:
The operation called the employee the day of the inspection and got a current copy of the employee's driver's license. The copy of the license was placed in the employee's personnel folder. 

Update 9/31/25: Talked with the operation about where licenses were kept. The operation stated previously they kept licenses with employee I-9s which were not in personnel files. I-9s along with a copy of the driver's license have been placed in employee personnel folders.

Deficiency Narrative: During an HM visit, the operation could not produce a psychological exam completed on 09/2024 and several months have lapsed.
Correction Narrative: Inspection 7/23/25: Two child records were reviewed, and all documents that were required to be reviewed were in the folder except for medication logs. Medication logs are handled by the school nurses as well as medication binders. The operation stated they are working on consolidating their filing system. They currently have to ask multiple staff where certain documents are and look in different binders. This is an issue with both staff and child records. The operation is looking to have their consolidated filing system in place by the week of September 1st.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver was hired in 10/2021 and there was no trauma informed care training until 09/3/2024.
Correction Narrative:
The caregiver received Trauma Informed Care during the current annual year. A follow up plan will be discussed at the next inspection to ensure trainings do not continue to be an issue. 

Inspection 7/23/25: Two staff files were reviewed and both staff completed Trauma Informed Care for the current annual year. I interviewed administration about training concerns. They stated now that there is a staff dedicated to training, the operation as a whole is working to consolidate their binder organization process. They stated they are working on having one binder for each staff with Orientation, Pre-Service, and the current Annual Year of Training. They are hoping to have this system in place the week of September 1st.

Deficiency Narrative: A caregiver was hired in October 2021 and there was no psychotropic medication training until 2025.
Correction Narrative:
The caregiver received Psychotropic Medication during the current annual year. A follow up plan will be discussed at the next inspection to ensure trainings do not continue to be an issue. 

Inspection 7/23/25: Two staff files were reviewed and both staff completed Psychotropic Medication Training for the current annual year. I interviewed administration about training concerns. They stated now that there is a staff dedicated to training, the operation as a whole is working to consolidate their binder organization process. They stated they are working on having one binder for each staff with Orientation, Pre-Service, and the current Annual Year of Training. They are hoping to have this system in place the week of September 1st.

Deficiency Narrative: During a walkthrough of the operation it was noted that the front gate to home 25 cannot be closed due to a bent lock. It was also noted home 29 had parts of the fence broken.
Correction Narrative: Received pictures of repairs made to the fence and gate. Pictures will be uploaded to the document library for this inspection.

Deficiency Narrative: The EBI training reviewed for three staff members were not completed within the 6 months' timeframe.
Correction Narrative: Dr. Garver sent an email containing the SAMA training certificates for 4 employees that were completed in April. These 4 employees training files will be reviewed during an inspection after October to follow up and ensure EBI training was completed again after 6 months.

Deficiency Narrative: Three EBI training certificates did not document the number of training hours completed.
Correction Narrative: Dr. Garver sent an email containing updated training certificates that include the hours of training provided. These certificates will be uploaded to the document library.

Deficiency Narrative: One of the homes where children currently reside has missing or damaged fence pickets. There are also visible nails that are not properly driven in. Also, in this same home the skylight in the porch was damaged. Photographs were obtained.
Correction Narrative: Home 29 was observed. I observed the fence to be repaired. Photos were taken. The operation has talked to maintenance about closing the hole in the outside roof as opposed to replacing the plexiglas skylight.

Deficiency Narrative:
During the inspection at the operation:

House 12 had cleaning supplies that were accessible to youth in care in the kitchen, laundry room, under the boy's bathroom sink, and in the closet in the boy's bathroom.

House 29 had cleaning supplies unlocked and accessible to youth in care in the kitchen.
Correction Narrative: Poisons were observed to be locked up at all three facility homes.

Deficiency Narrative: During the walk through of house 12, there were three knives, a screwdriver, and sharp freezer thermometer was unlocked and accessible to children in care.
Correction Narrative: Tools were observed to be locked up and inaccessible in all three facility homes.

Deficiency Narrative: There is no documented trauma informed care training for a caregiver during 2023 and 2024.
Correction Narrative: An inspection was conducted at the operation and staff files were reviewed. No training concerns were noted. Dr. Garver stated that the operation is still working to get everyone on the same training schedule, but this can be difficult due to the amount of staff.

Deficiency Narrative: There was no documented psychotropic medication training for a caregiver during 2023 or 2024.
Correction Narrative: An inspection was conducted at the operation and staff files were reviewed. No training concerns were noted. Dr. Garver stated that the operation is still working to get everyone on the same training schedule, but this can be difficult due to the amount of staff.

Deficiency Narrative: Two employee files were reviewed, and their SAMA training certificates for the previous annual year could not be provided.
Correction Narrative: Both employees were observed to have completed SAMA training certificates dated 4/12/2025 at the Heightened Monitoring Inspection on 4/14/2025. The operation stated they are currently working with people to help solidify their employee training schedule so that there are no more missed trainings.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection at the operation, cleaning supplies and other chemicals were observed in the laundry room, kitchen, and closet in the boy's bedroom that were all unlocked and accessible to the youth in care.
Caregivers were not aware of child's on-going activity, which led to inappropriate contact with residents.
Correction Narrative: The operation implemented a safety plan to ensure there is a response to motion detectors. The staff and children in care were provided additional training/coaching on privacy and intervention.

Deficiency Narrative: When reviewing annual training hours, it was found that two employees had not completed Normalcy training, and one employee's Trauma Informed Care training had expired on June 9, 2023.
Correction Narrative: Compliance was met when the operation provided training certificates of the required trainings that were missing for each staff member.

Deficiency Narrative: One of the two bathrooms did not have toilet paper in the bathroom. This was corrected at Inspection, when staff put toilet paper in the bathroom
An SIR report does not document a debriefing with the child.
Correction Narrative: Staff was trained on behavioral techniques on 7/5/2024 the operation submitted a waiver/variance due to children not having the cognitive functioning to understand debriefing.

Deficiency Narrative:
14- and 16-year-old children in care were left unsupervised by a caregiver. This resulted in a physical altercation, damaged property, and self-harm. 

At an inspection completed on 1/3/2024, this standard was evaluated for compliance and found to be compliant, the operation terminated the staff member involved in the incident.
Correction Narrative: On 1/3/2024 RCCR conducted an inspection at the operation, the operation came into compliance by terminating the staff member.

Deficiency Narrative: Children in care's supervision plan required constant supervision. This plan was not followed by direct care staff.
Correction Narrative: On 1/3/2024 RCCR conducted an inspection at the operation, the operation came into compliance by terminating the staff member. In addition the operation submitted a plan to retrain staff on the supervision policy on 1/11/2024.

Deficiency Narrative: Five of five child's records reviewed contained service plans that were missing required signatures.
Correction Narrative: Dr. Graver emailed the children's service with updates and the operations plan to ensure the service plans will be updated every 90 days.

Deficiency Narrative: Five of the five child files reviewed contained service plans that did not have two professionals participate.
Correction Narrative: Dr. Graver emailed the children's service with updates and the operations plan to ensure the service plans will be updated every 90 days.

Deficiency Narrative: Three of the five child files reviewed contained service plans that did not indicate if the child participated in the service plan.
Correction Narrative: Dr. Graver emailed the children's service with updates and the operations plan to ensure the service plans will be updated every 90 days.

Deficiency Narrative: Four of the five child files reviewed contained service plans that were not completed every 90 days.
Correction Narrative: Dr. Graver emailed the children's service with updates and the operations plan to ensure the service plans will be updated every 90 days.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care touches a caregiver's back. The caregiver turns and gestures as if to hit the child due to this interaction.
Correction Narrative: The child was observed by RCCR on 06/07/2023, no concerns were observed. On 06/21/2023 a corrective action place was implemented by the operation. The staff member was provided behavior intervention training and the worker's capability to continue working with OV was assessed. The operation is requesting an administrative review.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation had not validated their person list in the last 12 months.
Correction Narrative: This inspector received an email on 5/11/2023 from the Director stating she spoke with the HR Director, and she validated the staff in the system and in the future, HR will validate the employees quarterly. HR will post the dates on the administrative calendar as a reminder to validate the employees. CLASS showed the last validation date was on 05/09/2023.

Deficiency Narrative: The child's prescription required that Pediasure, Risperidone and Clonidine should be given 3 times daily. Methylphenidate was prescribed daily. This recommendation was not being followed.
Correction Narrative: On 5/11/2023 this inspector received an email from the Director stating that the staff that did not document the medication administration has retaken the medication refresher training and certificates were provided.

Deficiency Narrative: Of the five child files reviewed, two had a service plan team meeting invite that was not sent out to the CPS worker.
Correction Narrative: A plan was put into place to ensure service plan emails will be sent out to CPS Workers.

Deficiency Narrative: Numerous medication logs did not document the prescribing physician's name, the reason for the medication or the administration of the medication.
Correction Narrative: An email was received with the following corrections physician's name, the reason for the medication, the administration of the medication, and a plan to ensure the accuracy of the medication logs in the future.

Deficiency Narrative: There were 2 staff members that did not complete Trauma Informed Care training in 2021.
Correction Narrative: Staff members' Trauma Informed Care training certificates.

Deficiency Narrative: The CANS Assessment for 5 children in care recommended that the child participate in Case Management and Skills Training and see a Developmental Disability Specialist these services were not being provided to the child.
Correction Narrative: A plan was emailed on how the operation will ensure that the children's services will be completed.

Deficiency Narrative: Of the three child files reviewed, one child's file did not have the Child Right's form signed by the child and one child's file did not have the form.
Correction Narrative: The agency sent an email with the signed and dated Child's Rights form. The agency stated they also received a blank copy of the form to keep on hand in the event CPS does not bring the form when new placements are done.

Deficiency Narrative:
One employee who has been transporting children has an expired drivers license.

The agency came into compliance during the inspection by having the employee sign a statement that he would not transport children in care until he provides the facility with a copy of his updated and current driver's license.
Serious incident reports were not being documented.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the agency containing recent serious incident reports that had not been filled out prior. The email also stated a certain person has been designated as the person responsible for filling out all serious incident reports; as soon as the person is notified they will complete an SIR.

Deficiency Narrative:
There was one prescription medication that was in the refrigerator not locked up.  

While at the facility, the medication was placed in a locked box and placed back in the fridge.

During the walk through of all four resident homes there were broken blinds, a hole in a closet door, mold in two bathrooms, a broken soap holder in one shower, and numerous used cigarettes butts on ground outside one home.
Correction Narrative: During the walk through of all four resident homes there were broken blinds, a hole in a closet door, mold in two bathrooms, a broken soap holder in one shower, and numerous used cigarettes butts on ground outside one home.

Deficiency Narrative: The facility has not been documenting unauthorized absences.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the agency containing a copy of the agency's unauthorized absence log which the agency will now use when needed. The email also stated a certain person has been designated as the person responsible for filling out the unauthorized log, as soon as the person is notified they will complete the log.

Deficiency Narrative: Multiple medication logs reviewed did not have the prescribing professional's name or the reason the medication was prescribed documented on the log.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the agency. The medication logs have been updated to include the prescribing doctor's information.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care ran out of the room after being slapped. Two staff members observed this incident and did not respond.
Correction Narrative: Staff and caregivers participated in additional training/retraining in emergency behavior intervention (EBI) de-escalation procedures and blocking pad use. Staff and caregivers were also retrained in assisting other staff during an intervention.

Deficiency Narrative: Physical discipline was used on a child in care.
Correction Narrative: The staff member involved in this incident was terminated. All other staff and caregivers participated in additional training/retraining in emergency behavior intervention (EBI) de-escalation procedures and blocking pad use. Staff and caregivers were also retrained in assisting other staff during an intervention.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care hit a staff member multiple times. The staff member did not implement a restraint.
Correction Narrative: Staff and caregivers participated in additional training/retraining in emergency behavior intervention (EBI) de-escalation procedures and blocking pad use. Staff and caregivers were also retrained in assisting other staff during an intervention. The staff member involved in this incident has also been terminated.

Deficiency Narrative: A 14 year old child in care sustained injuries to the face from being slapped by a staff member.
Correction Narrative: A 14 year old child in care sustained injuries to the face from being slapped by a staff member.

Deficiency Narrative: In one of the homes it was observed that a child was sleeping on a mattress on the floor.
Correction Narrative: In one of the homes it was observed that a child was sleeping on a mattress on the floor.

Deficiency Narrative: A child's service plan is not tailored to their individual and specific supervision needs.
Correction Narrative: The child's service plan has been updated regarding the child's specific supervision needs and requirements.

Deficiency Narrative: A child had a safety plan in place stating he would remain in line of sight supervision but this was not followed by the caregiver which resulted in the child injuring another child in care.
Correction Narrative: The child's service plan has been updated regarding the child's specific supervision needs and requirements.

Deficiency Narrative: Children in care were left unattended with distributed medication.
A child in care took another child's medication.
A staff member has used inappropriate language around children in care multiple times and has made inappropriate remarks to children in care.
Correction Narrative: Email received from the agency stating management had talk meeting with the staff involved and the staff will no longer be allowed to work with children at the facility.

Deficiency Narrative: On 06/20/2021 A Direct Care Worker, who recently failed to supervise a child appropriately, left a child in care unattended again. The Direct Care Worker took a shower. The child's service plan required constant supervision to prevent aggressive behaviors and elopement. While unattended the child walked 3 miles away from the facility.
Correction Narrative: Email was received from the operation containing a compliance plan. The compliance plan stated the staff member has officially been terminated, a meeting was held with management staff, meeting was held with house staff on 8/20/21 where they discussed the importance of line of sight supervision, additional staff will be added when needed, and room assignments were modified.

Deficiency Narrative: On 06/19/2021 a Direct Care Worker grilled food outside of the home. This act left a 15 year old child  in care unattended. The child in care had a history of aggressive behaviors. While unsupervised the child in care engaged in inappropriate sexual contact with an adult in care.
Correction Narrative: Email was received from the operation containing a compliance plan. The compliance plan stated the staff member has officially been terminated, a meeting was held with management staff, meeting was held with house staff on 8/20/21 where they discussed the importance of line of sight supervision, additional staff will be added when needed, and room assignments were modified.

Deficiency Narrative: One child's file reviewed did not have the Child's Rights form signed by the child.
Correction Narrative: One child's file reviewed did not have the Child's Rights form signed by the child.

Deficiency Narrative: Multiple cleaners and chemicals were observed to be accessible to children.
Two employee files did not have a signed statment for reporting suspected abuse or neglect.
Correction Narrative: Two employee files did not have a signed statment for reporting suspected abuse or neglect.

Deficiency Narrative: Homes were inspected and were found to have multiple chairs with rips/holes, one door with a hole, and lightswitch plates coming off the wall.
Correction Narrative: Homes were inspected and were found to have multiple chairs with rips/holes, one door with a hole, and lightswitch plates coming off the wall.
